Package sailpoint.api

Class PolicyUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.api.PolicyUtil
  • public class PolicyUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities for analyzing policies and policy violations.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  PolicyUtil.ApplicationSummary
      Model for entitlements on a specific application account.
      static class  PolicyUtil.EntitlementSummary
      Model for representing entitlements related to SOD violations.
      static class  PolicyUtil.ItemSummary
      Model for one entitlement in an application.
      static class  PolicyUtil.RoleSummary
      Represents a collection of application-specific entitlements, either "free" (the name is null) or associated with a role.

    • Field Detail

      • PRAGMA_SOD

        public static final java.lang.String PRAGMA_SOD
        Pragma used in rules/scripts that appear in one of the two IdentitySelectors in an Entitlement SOD policy. Example: 
           // @SOD application='AD' name='memberOf' value='Domain Admins'
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

           // @SODLeft application='AD' name='memberOf' value='Domain Admins'

    • Method Detail

      • summarizeViolationEntitlements

        public static PolicyUtil.EntitlementSummary summarizeViolationEntitlements​(SailPointContext context,
                                                                           Identity identity,
                                                                           PolicyViolation pv,
                                                                           EntitlementCorrelator correlator)
                                                                    throws GeneralException
        Generate a PolicyViolation summary object containing details about the entitlements for a particular identity that were responsible for the violation. For Role SOD this will be the entitlements that gave them the role involved in the violation. For Entitlement SOD it will be the entitlements that caused a match in the policy rule. Note that the left/right roles in the violation will be the ones actually held by the identity. These are not necessarily the same as the roles in the SODConstraint definition, they can be SUBROLES of the roles in the policy. Only need to include entitlements from the policy roles not the sub roles.
        Parameters:
        context - The SailPointContext.
        identity - The Identity.
        pv - The PolicyViolation for which to create the summary.
        correlator - The EntitlementCorrelator to use - if null this will be created automatically.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • getRolePath

        public static java.util.List<IdentityItem.Path> getRolePath​(Bundle src,
                                                            Bundle target)
                                                     throws GeneralException
        Calculate the relationship path from one role to another. Both roles must be in the same Hibernate session.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • parsePragma

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> parsePragma​(java.lang.String pragma)
        Parse a pragma line into a Map. The line is expected to follow pseudo-XML attribute syntax: foo='x' bar='y' Character entities (<, ") are not recognized. Backslash is an escape character.
